allowedHeaders.description: Comma separated string of allowed headers.

anyOf.description: Comma separated string of exposed headers.

swaggerPrefix.description: Base URL for the OpenAPI Swagger Documentation

path.description: Path to an OpenAPI spec file

prefix.description: Base URL for generated Platformatic DB routes

adminSecret.description: The password should be used to access routes under /_admin prefix and for admin access to REST and GraphQL endpoints with X-PLATFORMATIC-ADMIN-SECRET header.

roleKey.description: The user metadata key to store user roles

rolePath.description: The user metadata path to store user roles

anonymousRole.description: The role name for anonymous users

namespace.description: the namespace for JWT custom claims

entity.description: the DB entity type to which the rule applies

role.description: the role name to match the rule

entities.description: the DB entity types to which the rule applies

role.description: the role name to match the rule

dir.description: The path to the directory containing the migrations.

table.description: Table created to track schema version.

autoApply.description: Whether to automatically apply migrations when running the migrate command.

newline.description: Force line ending on file when generating checksum. Value should be either CRLF (windows) or LF (unix/mac).

currentSchema.description: For Postgres and MS SQL Server(will ignore for another DBs). Specifies schema to look to when validating `versions` table columns. For Postgres, run's `SET search_path = currentSchema` prior to running queries against db.

dir.description: The path to the directory the types should be generated in.

applicationName.description: The name of the application. Defaults to the folder name if not specified.

skip.description: An array of paths to skip when creating spans. Useful for health checks and other endpoints that do not need to be traced.

path.description: The path to skip. Can be a string or a regex.

options.description: Options for the exporter. These are passed directly to the exporter.

url.description: The URL to send the traces to. Not used for console or memory exporters.

headers.description: Headers to send to the exporter. Not used for console or memory exporters.

path.description: The path to write the traces to. Only for file exporter.

options.description: Options for the exporter. These are passed directly to the exporter.

url.description: The URL to send the traces to. Not used for console or memory exporters.

headers.description: Headers to send to the exporter. Not used for console or memory exporters.

path.description: The path to write the traces to. Only for file exporter.

instrumentations.description: An array of instrumentations loaded if telemetry is enabled

enabled.description: Enable Node.js module compile cache for faster startup

directory.description: Directory to store compile cache. Defaults to .plt/compile-cache in app root

backlog.description: The maximum length of the queue of pending connections

closeConnections.description: Add Connection: close header to HTTP responses during graceful shutdown

origins.description: Whitelist of origins to cache. Supports exact strings and regex patterns (e.g., "/https:\\/\\/.*\\.example\\.com/").

cacheByDefault.description: Default cache duration in seconds for responses without explicit expiration headers.

type.description: Cache type. "shared" caches may be shared between users, "private" caches are user-specific.

socket.description: Custom path for the control socket. If not specified, uses the default platform-specific location.

applicationLabel.description: The label name to use for the application identifier in metrics (e.g., applicationId, serviceId)

otlpExporter.description: Configuration for exporting metrics to an OTLP endpoint

enabled.description: Enable or disable OTLP metrics export

interval.description: Interval in milliseconds between metric pushes

serviceName.description: Service name for OTLP resource attributes

serviceVersion.description: Service version for OTLP resource attributes

httpCustomLabels.description: Custom labels to add to HTTP metrics (http_request_all_duration_seconds). Each label extracts its value from an HTTP request header.

name.description: The label name to use in metrics

header.description: The HTTP request header to extract the value from

default.description: Default value when header is missing (defaults to "unknown")

applicationName.description: The name of the application. Defaults to the folder name if not specified.

skip.description: An array of paths to skip when creating spans. Useful for health checks and other endpoints that do not need to be traced.

path.description: The path to skip. Can be a string or a regex.

options.description: Options for the exporter. These are passed directly to the exporter.

url.description: The URL to send the traces to. Not used for console or memory exporters.

headers.description: Headers to send to the exporter. Not used for console or memory exporters.

path.description: The path to write the traces to. Only for file exporter.

options.description: Options for the exporter. These are passed directly to the exporter.

url.description: The URL to send the traces to. Not used for console or memory exporters.

headers.description: Headers to send to the exporter. Not used for console or memory exporters.

path.description: The path to write the traces to. Only for file exporter.

enabled.description: Enable Node.js module compile cache for faster startup

directory.description: Directory to store compile cache. Defaults to .plt/compile-cache in app root

instrumentations.description: An array of instrumentations loaded if telemetry is enabled

enabled.description: Enable Node.js module compile cache for faster startup

directory.description: Directory to store compile cache. Defaults to .plt/compile-cache in app root

fields.description: array of enabled field for the operation

oneOf.description: true if enabled (with not authorization constraints enabled)
